paperBagMaking.title: Paper Bag Making
paperBagMaking.description: Learn to create eco-friendly paper bags from recycled materials. Perfect for small businesses and sustainable packaging solutions.

1.title: Gather Materials
1.description: Lay out newspaper, glue stick, scissors, and rope on a clean surface.

2.title: Fold Bottom Edge
2.description: Fold the bottom of the newspaper upward by 3 inches. Use a ruler to keep the fold straight.

3.title: Apply Glue to Flap
3.description: Place visible glue dots along the inside edge of the folded flap. Keep the glue bottle close.

4.title: Shape into a Bag
4.description: Fold the paper into a rectangular bag. Use arrows to guide folds. Glue only the red-marked areas.

5.title: Add Rope Handles
5.description: Punch holes near the top. Thread jute rope through and tie secure knots inside.

6.title: Complete
6.description: The paper bag is done and is ready for use.

sanitizerMaking.title: Sanitizer Making
sanitizerMaking.description: Learn to make effective hand sanitizers at home with proper alcohol content and skin-friendly ingredients.

1.title: Gather Ingredients
1.description: Place isopropyl alcohol, aloe vera gel, essential oil, and a funnel on a clean surface.

2.title: Measure Alcohol
2.description: Pour 3 parts of isopropyl alcohol into a measuring cup while wearing protective gloves.

3.title: Mix Ingredients
3.description: Combine components in a bowl; stir until the mixture becomes slightly opaque and thickens.

4.title: Fill Bottle
4.description: Use a funnel to pour the sanitizer into a bottle, noting liquid levels at every 100ml.

5.title: Label Bottle
5.description: Apply a label marked "70% ALCOHOL" with a visible flame hazard symbol.

6.title: Ready to Use
6.description: Your homemade hand sanitizer is now complete and ready for safe use.

candleMaking.title: Candle Making
candleMaking.description: Learn the art of making beautiful, scented candles for personal use or to start a small business.

1.title: Melt the Wax
1.description: Place wax chunks in a heat-safe pot and melt them on a stove over low to medium heat. Stir occasionally to ensure even melting.

2.title: Add Fragrance and Dye
2.description: Add a few drops of fragrance oil and liquid dye to the melted wax. This gives the candle a pleasant scent and color.

3.title: Pour Wax Into Container
3.description: Pour the wax into a prepared container, leaving space at the top for the wick. Use a chopstick or pencil to center the wick.

4.title: Insert and Trim the Wick
4.description: Insert the wick into the wax, leaving a small amount above the surface. Trim the wick to 1/4 inch above the wax level.

clothBagMaking.title: Cloth Bag Making
clothBagMaking.description: Learn to create reusable and eco-friendly cloth bags. Perfect for sustainable shopping and reducing plastic waste.

1.title: Gather Materials
1.description: You'll need fabric (cotton or canvas), scissors, thread, sewing machine or needle, measuring tape, and pins.

2.title: Cut the Fabric
2.description: Measure and cut the fabric according to your desired bag size. A standard size is 40cm x 45cm for the main piece and 60cm x 10cm for handles.

3.title: Sew the Sides
3.description: Fold the fabric in half with the right sides together and sew along the sides, leaving the top open. Reinforce the corners for durability.

4.title: Create the Bottom
4.description: Flatten the bottom corners to create a box shape and sew across to form the base of the bag.

5.title: Make and Attach Handles
5.description: Fold and sew the handle strips, then attach them securely to the top edges of the bag.

6.title: Finish the Top Edge
6.description: Fold and hem the top edge of the bag for a clean finish. Add any decorative elements if desired.

maskMaking.title: Mask Making
maskMaking.description: Learn to make comfortable and effective cloth masks with proper filtration layers.

1.title: Gather Materials
1.description: You'll need cotton fabric, elastic bands or fabric ties, scissors, thread, sewing machine or needle, and pins.

2.title: Cut the Fabric
2.description: Cut two pieces of fabric (20cm x 15cm) for the outer layer and two pieces for the inner layer. Cut elastic bands to 15cm length.

3.title: Sew the Layers
3.description: Place the fabric pieces right sides together and sew along the curved edges, leaving the straight edge open for turning.

4.title: Add Pleats
4.description: Create three pleats on each side of the mask and secure them with pins. Sew across the pleats to hold them in place.

5.title: Attach Elastic
5.description: Fold the edges and sew to create channels for the elastic. Insert the elastic and secure the ends.

6.title: Final Touches
6.description: Add a nose wire if desired and ensure all edges are properly finished. Wash the mask before first use.

diyaMaking.title: Diya Making
diyaMaking.description: Learn to create beautiful clay diyas for festivals, home decoration, and special occasions.

1.title: Prepare the Clay
1.description: Knead the clay until it's soft and pliable. Add water if needed to achieve the right consistency.

2.title: Shape the Base
2.description: Roll the clay into a ball and flatten it to form the base of the diya. Make it about 1cm thick.

3.title: Form the Walls
3.description: Create the walls by pinching and shaping the edges upward. Make sure the walls are even and about 2-3cm high.

4.title: Add Decoration
4.description: Use tools to create patterns or add small clay decorations. Let your creativity flow!

5.title: Dry and Paint
5.description: Let the diya dry completely, then paint it with acrylic colors. Add glitter or other decorations if desired.

6.title: Final Touches
6.description: Apply a clear varnish to protect the paint and add shine. Let it dry before use.

sanitaryPadMaking.title: Sanitary Pad Making
sanitaryPadMaking.description: Learn to make reusable, eco-friendly sanitary pads using natural materials.

1.title: Gather Materials
1.description: You'll need cotton fabric, waterproof fabric (PUL), absorbent material, thread, scissors, and sewing machine or needle.

2.title: Cut the Layers
2.description: Cut the top layer (cotton), middle layer (absorbent material), and bottom layer (waterproof fabric) to the desired size.

3.title: Assemble the Layers
3.description: Layer the materials: cotton on top, absorbent material in the middle, and waterproof fabric at the bottom.

4.title: Sew the Layers
4.description: Sew around the edges, leaving a small opening. Trim excess fabric and turn right side out.

5.title: Add Wings
5.description: Cut and attach wings to the sides. Add snaps or buttons for secure fastening.

6.title: Final Steps
6.description: Wash the pad before first use. Store in a clean, dry place when not in use.
